Bar rests on front deltoids and clavicle. The upright torso position shifts load forward onto quads and away from glutes/hamstrings. EMG studies show 20-25% more quad activation than back squat. Also heavily challenges core and upper back. Excellent for those with lower back issues as it compresses the spine less. Requires good ankle/wrist mobility.

Don't lock knees at top—keep slight bend for tension and safety. Don't let lower back round at bottom (butt wink).

name_en: *Reverse hack squat* (facing pad - more glute emphasis); *narrow stance hack squat* (maximum quad sweep); *single-leg hack squat*; *1.5 rep hack squat*. Back against pad, shoulders under shoulder pads, feet on platform. The fixed path allows focus entirely on pushing without balance concerns. Excellent for targeting the outer quad sweep (vastus lateralis). Narrow stance emphasizes quads; wider stance shifts to glutes. Don't lock knees at top.
name_ar: *Reverse hack squat* (facing pad - more glute emphasis); *narrow stance hack squat* (maximum quad sweep); *single-leg hack squat*; *1.5 rep hack squat*. Back against pad, shoulders under shoulder pads, feet on platform. The fixed path allows focus entirely on pushing without balance concerns. Excellent for targeting the outer quad sweep (vastus lateralis). Narrow stance emphasizes quads; wider stance shifts to glutes. Don't lock knees at top. (AR)

name_en: *Lateral step-up* (step to side - more adductor/medial emphasis); *high step-up* (higher box - more glute); *deficit step-up* (start from lower position); *crossover step-up* (rear foot crosses behind). Step onto elevated surface, drive through front foot to stand up, step down with same leg. Keep all work in front leg—don't push off back foot (common cheat). Excellent functional movement that builds unilateral strength. Box height determines glute vs. quad emphasis (higher = more glute).
name_ar: *Lateral step-up* (step to side - more adductor/medial emphasis); *high step-up* (higher box - more glute); *deficit step-up* (start from lower position); *crossover step-up* (rear foot crosses behind). Step onto elevated surface, drive through front foot to stand up, step down with same leg. Keep all work in front leg—don't push off back foot (common cheat). Excellent functional movement that builds unilateral strength. Box height determines glute vs. quad emphasis (higher = more glute). (AR)

name_en: Machine guides weight in an arc rather than straight up/down. Similar to hack squat but with different resistance curve. Places consistent tension on quads throughout ROM. Excellent for targeting quad sweep and achieving deep stretch. Less common in gyms but highly effective when available.
name_ar: Machine guides weight in an arc rather than straight up/down. Similar to hack squat but with different resistance curve. Places consistent tension on quads throughout ROM. name_en: *Feet forward Smith squat* (feet in front of bar - more quad, less glute); *narrow stance Smith squat*; *Smith machine front squat*. Guided bar path eliminates balance requirement. Allows focus on quad contraction. Feet can be placed forward (impossible with free barbell) to increase quad emphasis. Good for beginners learning movement pattern or experienced lifters doing high-rep burnout sets. Not a replacement for free weight squats but a useful supplement.
name_ar: *Feet forward Smith squat* (feet in front of bar - more quad, less glute); *narrow stance Smith squat*; *Smith machine front squat*. Guided bar path eliminates balance requirement. Good for beginners learning movement pattern or experienced lifters doing high-rep burnout sets. Not a replacement for free weight squats but a useful supplement. (AR)

name_en: Same variations as 45-degree leg press. Less range of motion than 45-degree version. Lower back typically more supported. Good entry point for beginners. Safer for those with back issues as there's minimal spinal loading.
name_ar: Same variations as 45-degree leg press. Less range of motion than 45-degree version. Lower back typically more supported. Good entry point for beginners. Safer for those with back issues as there's minimal spinal loading. (AR)

name_en: *Wide stance belt squat* (more adductor); *marching belt squat* (alternating leg lift at top). Weight hangs from belt around hips rather than on shoulders/spine. Eliminates spinal compression entirely—excellent for those with back injuries or wanting to add quad volume without loading spine. Allows very upright torso. Underrated machine.
name_ar: *Wide stance belt squat* (more adductor); *marching belt squat* (alternating leg lift at top). Weight hangs from belt around hips rather than on shoulders/spine. Eliminates spinal compression entirely—excellent for those with back injuries or wanting to add quad volume without loading spine. Allows very upright torso. Underrated machine. (AR)

name_en: *Deficit reverse lunge* (front foot elevated); *barbell reverse lunge*; *walking reverse lunge*. Step backward into lunge position. Less stress on front knee than forward lunges because momentum doesn't push knee forward. Excellent for quad development with less injury risk. Keep torso upright, front knee at 90°.
name_ar: *Deficit reverse lunge* (front foot elevated); *barbell reverse lunge*; *walking reverse lunge*. Step backward into lunge position. Less stress on front knee than forward lunges because momentum doesn't push knee forward. Excellent for quad development with less injury risk. Keep torso upright, front knee at 90°. (AR)

name_en: *Landmine goblet squat* (cupping end of bar); *landmine hack squat* (bar behind you). One end of barbell in corner or landmine attachment, hold other end. The arc path naturally creates upright torso position like front squat. Good for learning squat mechanics or those lacking squat rack.
name_ar: *Landmine goblet squat* (cupping end of bar); *landmine hack squat* (bar behind you). One end of barbell in corner or landmine attachment, hold other end. name_en: *Bodyweight cyclist squat*; *dumbbell cyclist squat*; *barbell cyclist squat*. Narrow stance, heels elevated 2-4 inches on plates/wedge, squat with upright torso. Elevation allows deep knee flexion with upright torso, shifting nearly all work to quads. Bodybuilder favorite for pure quad isolation using free weights. Knees will travel significantly forward—this is intentional and safe.
name_ar: *Bodyweight cyclist squat*; *dumbbell cyclist squat*; *barbell cyclist squat*. Narrow stance, heels elevated 2-4 inches on plates/wedge, squat with upright torso. name_en: *Low box squat* (below parallel); *high box squat* (parallel or above); *pause box squat*. Squat down until sitting on box, pause briefly, drive up explosively. Teaches proper depth, builds explosive power from dead stop (eliminates stretch reflex), and reinforces sitting back into squat. Popular with powerlifters. Box height should put hip crease at or below knee.
name_ar: *Low box squat* (below parallel); *high box squat* (parallel or above); *pause box squat*. Squat down until sitting on box, pause briefly, drive up explosively. Teaches proper depth, builds explosive power from dead stop (eliminates stretch reflex), and reinforces sitting back into squat. Popular with powerlifters. Box height should put hip crease at or below knee. (AR)

name_en: *Dumbbell stiff-leg deadlift*; *deficit stiff-leg deadlift*; *single-leg stiff-leg deadlift*. Similar to RDL but with straighter legs (more knee extension) creating greater hamstring stretch. Knees nearly locked (slight soft bend only). Greater range of motion than RDL. Creates maximum stretch on hamstrings. Higher lower back demand than RDL—use lighter weight. Don't round back.
name_ar: *Dumbbell stiff-leg deadlift*; *deficit stiff-leg deadlift*; *single-leg stiff-leg deadlift*. Similar to RDL but with straighter legs (more knee extension) creating greater hamstring stretch. Knees nearly locked (slight soft bend only). Greater range of motion than RDL. Creates maximum stretch on hamstrings. Higher lower back demand than RDL—use lighter weight. Don't round back. (AR)

name_en: *Seated good morning* (eliminates lower body, isolates posterior chain); *safety squat bar good morning* (more comfortable); *banded good morning* (variable resistance); *pause good morning*. Bar on upper back (like squat), hinge forward at hips while keeping back flat, descend until torso near parallel to floor, return to standing. Excellent hamstring and lower back builder. Powerlifters use heavily. Requires strong core. Start light and master form before adding weight. Not for beginners.
name_ar: *Seated good morning* (eliminates lower body, isolates posterior chain); *safety squat bar good morning* (more comfortable); *banded good morning* (variable resistance); *pause good morning*. Bar on upper back (like squat), hinge forward at hips while keeping back flat, descend until torso near parallel to floor, return to standing. Excellent hamstring and lower back builder. Powerlifters use heavily. Requires strong core. Start light and master form before adding weight. Not for beginners. (AR)

name_en: *Single-leg seated curl*; *ISO hold seated curl* (hold contracted position). Sit in machine, pad above heels, curl heels under seat. The seated position puts hips in flexion, which stretches the hamstrings more than lying position. Research shows seated curls produce greater hamstring activation than lying curls (Schoenfeld et al.). Creates more muscle damage due to stretched position. Excellent for hypertrophy.
name_ar: *Single-leg seated curl*; *ISO hold seated curl* (hold contracted position). Sit in machine, pad above heels, curl heels under seat. The seated position puts hips in flexion, which stretches the hamstrings more than lying position. Research shows seated curls produce greater hamstring activation than lying curls (Schoenfeld et al.). Creates more muscle damage due to stretched position. Excellent for hypertrophy. (AR)

name_en: One leg at a time—excellent for fixing imbalances. Stand on one leg, other leg behind pad, curl heel toward glute. Good for mind-muscle connection and unilateral work. Include in routine if significant strength difference exists between legs.
name_ar: One leg at a time—excellent for fixing imbalances. Stand on one leg, other leg behind pad, curl heel toward glute. Good for mind-muscle connection and unilateral work. Include in routine if significant strength difference exists between legs. (AR)

name_en: Face away from cable, rope attachment between legs, hip hinge back (stretching hamstrings), drive hips forward to standing. Excellent for learning the hip hinge pattern before progressing to deadlifts/RDLs. Constant cable tension. Less lower back stress than barbell movements. Good for high reps and mind-muscle connection.
name_ar: Face away from cable, rope attachment between legs, hip hinge back (stretching hamstrings), drive hips forward to standing. Excellent for learning the hip hinge pattern before progressing to deadlifts/RDLs. Constant cable tension. Less lower back stress than barbell movements. name_en: *Wall hip hinge* (butt touches wall behind you); *dowel hip hinge* (dowel along spine to maintain neutral). Push hips back while keeping spine neutral, feel hamstring stretch, return to standing. Essential pattern to master before any loaded hip hinge. Practice daily until pattern is automatic.
name_ar: *Wall hip hinge* (butt touches wall behind you); *dowel hip hinge* (dowel along spine to maintain neutral). Push hips back while keeping spine neutral, feel hamstring stretch, return to standing. Essential pattern to master before any loaded hip hinge. Practice daily until pattern is automatic. (AR)

name_en: Wide stance (shins vertical, toes pointed out), grip inside legs, drive through floor. The wide stance shifts some load from hamstrings to adductors and glutes, but the inner hamstrings (semis) are still heavily involved. Good variation for those with longer torsos or limited hip mobility.
name_ar: Wide stance (shins vertical, toes pointed out), grip inside legs, drive through floor. name_en: Stand inside bar, grip handles, drive up. Neutral grip easier on shoulders and biceps. Weight centered around body reduces lower back stress. More quad-dominant than barbell deadlift but still works hamstrings significantly. Excellent for beginners and those with back issues.
name_ar: Stand inside bar, grip handles, drive up. Neutral grip easier on shoulders and biceps. Weight centered around body reduces lower back stress. More quad-dominant than barbell deadlift but still works hamstrings significantly. Excellent for beginners and those with back issues. (AR)

name_en: *Weighted hyperextension* (hold plate on chest); *single-leg hyperextension*; *rounded back hyperextension* (more erector focus). Hips on pad, lower torso toward floor, extend back up. Round back slightly to emphasize erectors, keep flat/neutral to emphasize hamstrings. Foot position matters: toes turned out = more glutes; toes straight = more hamstrings. Don't hyperextend at top.
name_ar: *Weighted hyperextension* (hold plate on chest); *single-leg hyperextension*; *rounded back hyperextension* (more erector focus). Hips on pad, lower torso toward floor, extend back up. name_en: Lie face-down on machine, torso on pad, hold handles, swing legs up behind you. Unlike regular hyperextension, this decompresses the spine rather than loading it. Excellent for back health while training posterior chain. Invented by Louie Simmons (Westside Barbell) for back rehab.
name_ar: Lie face-down on machine, torso on pad, hold handles, swing legs up behind you. Unlike regular hyperextension, this decompresses the spine rather than loading it. Excellent for back health while training posterior chain. Invented by Louie Simmons (Westside Barbell) for back rehab. (AR)

name_en: *See Hamstrings section for full details.* Hip hinge pattern that loads glutes during the hip extension (standing up) portion. While hamstring-focused, produces significant glute activation. The glute-hamstring relationship means these muscles work together in hip hinge patterns. Keep bar close to body, drive hips forward at top with glute squeeze.

name_en: *High step-up* (higher box = more glute); *lateral step-up* (step to side - adds medius work); *crossover step-up*; *weighted step-up*. Step onto elevated surface, drive through heel of top foot (don't push off bottom foot), stand fully upright with hip extension, step down with control. Functional movement that mimics real-life activities (stairs, hiking). Higher box = more glute; lower box = more quad. Don't bounce or use momentum.
name_ar: *High step-up* (higher box = more glute); *lateral step-up* (step to side - adds medius work); *crossover step-up*; *weighted step-up*. Step onto elevated surface, drive through heel of top foot (don't push off bottom foot), stand fully upright with hip extension, step down with control. Functional movement that mimics real-life activities (stairs, hiking). Higher box = more glute; lower box = more quad. Don't bounce or use momentum. (AR)

name_en: Wide stance (shins vertical at start), toes pointed out 45°, grip inside legs. The wide stance and external rotation create high glute activation compared to conventional deadlift. Also loads adductors (inner thigh). Good for lifters with longer torsos or limited ankle mobility. Drive knees out over toes throughout lift.
name_ar: Wide stance (shins vertical at start), toes pointed out 45°, grip inside legs. The wide stance and external rotation create high glute activation compared to conventional deadlift. Also loads adductors (inner thigh). Good for lifters with longer torsos or limited ankle mobility. Drive knees out over toes throughout lift. (AR)

name_en: *Low bar position* (bar on rear delts - more forward lean - more glute/hamstring); *wide stance squat* (more glute/adductor); *pause squat* (pause in hole - removes stretch reflex, increases glute demand). Going below parallel (hip crease below knee) is required for maximum glute activation. Research shows partial squats (above parallel) produce significantly less glute activity. Depth + external rotation (knees out) = maximum glute recruitment.
name_ar: *Low bar position* (bar on rear delts - more forward lean - more glute/hamstring); *wide stance squat* (more glute/adductor); *pause squat* (pause in hole - removes stretch reflex, increases glute demand). Going below parallel (hip crease below knee) is required for maximum glute activation. Research shows partial squats (above parallel) produce significantly less glute activity. Depth + external rotation (knees out) = maximum glute recruitment. (AR)

name_en: *Deficit reverse lunge* (front foot elevated - greater ROM); *reverse lunge to step-up*; *walking reverse lunges*. Step backward into lunge position, lower until back knee nearly touches floor, drive through front heel to return. Longer stride = more glute emphasis. Less knee stress than forward lunges. Keep torso upright or lean slightly forward for more glute activation.
name_ar: *Deficit reverse lunge* (front foot elevated - greater ROM); *reverse lunge to step-up*; *walking reverse lunges*. Step backward into lunge position, lower until back knee nearly touches floor, drive through front heel to return. Longer stride = more glute emphasis. Less knee stress than forward lunges. Keep torso upright or lean slightly forward for more glute activation. (AR)

name_en: *Straight-leg side raise*; *bent-knee side raise*; *weighted side raise*. Lie on side, lift top leg toward ceiling while keeping toes pointed forward (not up). Isolates hip abductors without hip flexor involvement. Keep hips stacked vertically—don't roll backward. Control the negative (lowering) phase. Small range of motion is normal—quality over quantity.
name_ar: *Straight-leg side raise*; *bent-knee side raise*; *weighted side raise*. Lie on side, lift top leg toward ceiling while keeping toes pointed forward (not up). Isolates hip abductors without hip flexor involvement. Keep hips stacked vertically—don't roll backward. Control the negative (lowering) phase. Small range of motion is normal—quality over quantity. (AR)

name_en: Stand side-on to low cable, attach ankle strap to far leg, lift leg away from cable. Standing variation allows heavier loading than side-lying. Good for progressive overload on hip abductors. Keep standing leg slightly bent for balance. Don't lean excessively away from working leg.
name_ar: Stand side-on to low cable, attach ankle strap to far leg, lift leg away from cable. Standing variation allows heavier loading than side-lying. Good for progressive overload on hip abductors. Keep standing leg slightly bent for balance. Don't lean excessively away from working leg. (AR)

name_en: *B-stance RDL* (easier - back foot lightly touching for balance); *kickstand RDL* (back foot more support). Stand on one leg, hinge forward at hip while extending free leg behind, touch weight to ground (or near), drive through planted heel to return. Unilateral hip hinge that challenges balance and glute medius stability while loading glute max. Fixes strength imbalances and builds functional stability. Don't let hips rotate open—keep them square.
name_ar: *B-stance RDL* (easier - back foot lightly touching for balance); *kickstand RDL* (back foot more support). Stand on one leg, hinge forward at hip while extending free leg behind, touch weight to ground (or near), drive through planted heel to return. Unilateral hip hinge that challenges balance and glute medius stability while loading glute max. Fixes strength imbalances and builds functional stability. Don't let hips rotate open—keep them square. (AR)

name_en: *Walking curtsy lunge*; *deficit curtsy lunge*. Step back and across behind front leg (as if curtsying), lower into lunge, return to start. The crossing pattern creates unique stress on both glute max (hip extension) and medius (controlling rotation). Burns all three glute muscles simultaneously. Keep front knee tracking over toes (don't let it collapse inward).
name_ar: *Walking curtsy lunge*; *deficit curtsy lunge*. Step back and across behind front leg (as if curtsying), lower into lunge, return to start. The crossing pattern creates unique stress on both glute max (hip extension) and medius (controlling rotation). Burns all three glute muscles simultaneously. Keep front knee tracking over toes (don't let it collapse inward). (AR)

name_en: Machine version of hip thrust. Guided path allows focus on contraction without balance concerns. Often allows heavier loading than barbell version. Good for beginners or high-rep work. Replicate the same movement pattern—full hip extension with glute squeeze at top.
name_ar: Machine version of hip thrust. Guided path allows focus on contraction without balance concerns. Often allows heavier loading than barbell version. Good for beginners or high-rep work. Replicate the same movement pattern—full hip extension with glute squeeze at top. (AR)

name_en: Sit on bench, place block/plates under balls of feet, rest dumbbell(s) on knees, perform calf raises. Home-gym alternative to seated calf machine. Creates same bent-knee position to isolate soleus. Heavier dumbbells or barbell across knees can be used as you progress.
name_ar: Sit on bench, place block/plates under balls of feet, rest dumbbell(s) on knees, perform calf raises. Home-gym alternative to seated calf machine. Creates same bent-knee position to isolate soleus. Heavier dumbbells or barbell across knees can be used as you progress. (AR)
description_en: A calf anatomy & overview exercise targeting the calves.
description_ar: تمرين CALF ANATOMY & OVERVIEW يستهدف Calves.

name_en: Position shoulders under pads, balls of feet on lower edge of platform, legs straight, press through toes. Similar to leg press calf raise. Allows heavy loading with stable platform. Keep back against pad, legs straight.
name_ar: Position shoulders under pads, balls of feet on lower edge of platform, legs straight, press through toes. Similar to leg press calf raise. Allows heavy loading with stable platform. Keep back against pad, legs straight. (AR)
description_en: A calf anatomy & overview exercise targeting the calves.
description_ar: تمرين CALF ANATOMY & OVERVIEW يستهدف Calves.

name_en: Stand on one foot (on step for extra ROM), perform calf raises. Hold dumbbell in same-side hand, use other hand for balance. Excellent for addressing left-right imbalances. Provides double the intensity per calf compared to bilateral versions. Essential if one calf is weaker.
name_ar: Stand on one foot (on step for extra ROM), perform calf raises. Hold dumbbell in same-side hand, use other hand for balance. Excellent for addressing left-right imbalances. Provides double the intensity per calf compared to bilateral versions. Essential if one calf is weaker. (AR)
description_en: A calf anatomy & overview exercise targeting the calves.
description_ar: تمرين CALF ANATOMY & OVERVIEW يستهدف Calves.

name_en: Continuous jumping on balls of feet. Plyometric calf training that also provides conditioning. Stay on balls of feet throughout—don't let heels touch. Multiple variations (single leg, double unders, running in place). Burns calories while building calf endurance. Great warm-up.
name_ar: Continuous jumping on balls of feet. Plyometric calf training that also provides conditioning. Stay on balls of feet throughout—don't let heels touch. Multiple variations (single leg, double unders, running in place). Burns calories while building calf endurance. Great warm-up. (AR)
description_en: A calf anatomy & overview exercise targeting the calves.
description_ar: تمرين CALF ANATOMY & OVERVIEW يستهدف Calves.

name_en: Small, quick, continuous hops using only ankle/calf movement (minimal knee bend). Focus on fast ground contact and immediate rebound. Excellent for calf power and Achilles tendon conditioning. Used by sprinters and jumpers. Keep jumps small (2-4 inches) and fast.
name_ar: Small, quick, continuous hops using only ankle/calf movement (minimal knee bend). Focus on fast ground contact and immediate rebound. Excellent for calf power and Achilles tendon conditioning. Used by sprinters and jumpers. Keep jumps small (2-4 inches) and fast. (AR)
description_en: A calf anatomy & overview exercise targeting the calves.
description_ar: تمرين CALF ANATOMY & OVERVIEW يستهدف Calves.

name_en: *Continuous box jumps* (jump up, step down, repeat quickly); *depth jumps* (step off box, immediately jump up). While a full-body plyometric, the calf muscles initiate and complete the jump movement. Builds explosive calf power used in sports. Focus on soft landings with bent knees to protect joints.
name_ar: *Continuous box jumps* (jump up, step down, repeat quickly); *depth jumps* (step off box, immediately jump up). While a full-body plyometric, the calf muscles initiate and complete the jump movement. Builds explosive calf power used in sports. Focus on soft landings with bent knees to protect joints. (AR)
description_en: A calf anatomy & overview exercise targeting the calves.
description_ar: تمرين CALF ANATOMY & OVERVIEW يستهدف Calves.

name_en: Perform leg press calf raise but with knees bent rather than straight. The bent knee position isolates soleus similar to seated calf raise. Allows heavy loading of soleus. Alternative when seated calf machine unavailable.
name_ar: Perform leg press calf raise but with knees bent rather than straight. The bent knee position isolates soleus similar to seated calf raise. Allows heavy loading of soleus. Alternative when seated calf machine unavailable. (AR)
description_en: A calf anatomy & overview exercise targeting the calves.
description_ar: تمرين CALF ANATOMY & OVERVIEW يستهدف Calves.

name_en: Stand with back against wall, heels 6 inches from wall, lift toes toward shins (dorsiflexion). Or use tib bar (specialized equipment) or stand on plate with toes hanging off back. Trains the front of lower leg (opposite of calf raises). Prevents shin splints, strengthens ankles, improves running mechanics. Often neglected but important for balanced lower leg development.
name_ar: Stand with back against wall, heels 6 inches from wall, lift toes toward shins (dorsiflexion). Or use tib bar (specialized equipment) or stand on plate with toes hanging off back. Trains the front of lower leg (opposite of calf raises). Prevents shin splints, strengthens ankles, improves running mechanics. Often neglected but important for balanced lower leg development. (AR)
description_en: A calf anatomy & overview exercise targeting the calves.
description_ar: تمرين CALF ANATOMY & OVERVIEW يستهدف Calves.

name_en: Perform farmer's walk while staying on balls of feet. Combines calf work with functional carry training. Extremely challenging for calf endurance. Keep core tight, don't let heels touch ground.
name_ar: Perform farmer's walk while staying on balls of feet. Combines calf work with functional carry training. Extremely challenging for calf endurance. Keep core tight, don't let heels touch ground. (AR)
description_en: A calf anatomy & overview exercise targeting the calves.
description_ar: تمرين CALF ANATOMY & OVERVIEW يستهدف Calves.

name_en: Run or walk up stairs quickly, pushing off from balls of feet. Functional calf training that builds endurance and power. Focus on driving through toes.
name_ar: Run or walk up stairs quickly, pushing off from balls of feet. Functional calf training that builds endurance and power. Focus on driving through toes. (AR)
description_en: A calf anatomy & overview exercise targeting the calves.
description_ar: تمرين CALF ANATOMY & OVERVIEW يستهدف Calves.

name_en: *Weighted standing raise* (ankle weights); *marching in place* (dynamic variation); *standing straight leg raise* (harder). Stand on one leg, raise other knee toward chest, lower with control, repeat. Mimics running motion. Good for hip flexor activation and single-leg stability.
name_ar: *Weighted standing raise* (ankle weights); *marching in place* (dynamic variation); *standing straight leg raise* (harder). Stand on one leg, raise other knee toward chest, lower with control, repeat. Mimics running motion. Good for hip flexor activation and single-leg stability. (AR)
description_en: A strengthening exercises exercise targeting the hip flexors.
description_ar: تمرين STRENGTHENING EXERCISES يستهدف Hip Flexors.

name_en: *Tuck L-sit* (knees bent - easier progression); *straddle L-sit* (legs wide - different leverage); *L-sit to V-sit*. Support body on hands with legs extended straight in front, parallel to floor. Intense isometric hip flexor hold that also challenges core and shoulders. Gymnastics foundational skill. Most people need to build up to this—start with tuck position.
name_ar: *Tuck L-sit* (knees bent - easier progression); *straddle L-sit* (legs wide - different leverage); *L-sit to V-sit*. Support body on hands with legs extended straight in front, parallel to floor. Intense isometric hip flexor hold that also challenges core and shoulders. Gymnastics foundational skill. Most people need to build up to this—start with tuck position. (AR)
description_en: A strengthening exercises exercise targeting the hip flexors.
description_ar: تمرين STRENGTHENING EXERCISES يستهدف Hip Flexors.

name_en: *Standing cable hip flexion* (ankle strap attached to low pulley); *banded psoas march* (band around foot, march in place). Provides constant tension throughout hip flexion movement. Good for controlled strengthening. Can use band looped around foot while lying or standing.
name_ar: *Standing cable hip flexion* (ankle strap attached to low pulley); *banded psoas march* (band around foot, march in place). Provides constant tension throughout hip flexion movement. Good for controlled strengthening. Can use band looped around foot while lying or standing. (AR)
description_en: A strengthening exercises exercise targeting the hip flexors.
description_ar: تمرين STRENGTHENING EXERCISES يستهدف Hip Flexors.

name_en: The decline position requires significant hip flexor involvement to initiate the sit-up. More hip flexor dominant than flat sit-ups. Don't anchor feet too securely—this increases hip flexor involvement.
name_ar: The decline position requires significant hip flexor involvement to initiate the sit-up. More hip flexor dominant than flat sit-ups. Don't anchor feet too securely—this increases hip flexor involvement. (AR)
description_en: A strengthening exercises exercise targeting the hip flexors.
description_ar: تمرين STRENGTHENING EXERCISES يستهدف Hip Flexors.

name_en: Loop band around feet, lie on back, alternately raise legs against band resistance in marching pattern. Targeted psoas strengthening often prescribed in physical therapy. Excellent for isolated hip flexor work without requiring hanging ability.
name_ar: Loop band around feet, lie on back, alternately raise legs against band resistance in marching pattern. Targeted psoas strengthening often prescribed in physical therapy. Excellent for isolated hip flexor work without requiring hanging ability. (AR)
description_en: A strengthening exercises exercise targeting the hip flexors.
description_ar: تمرين STRENGTHENING EXERCISES يستهدف Hip Flexors.

name_en: *Scissor kicks* (crossing pattern); *weighted flutter kicks* (ankle weights). Lie on back, lift both legs slightly off ground, make small rapid alternating kicks. Keep lower back pressed into floor. Good for hip flexor endurance. Often used in military fitness training.
name_ar: *Scissor kicks* (crossing pattern); *weighted flutter kicks* (ankle weights). Lie on back, lift both legs slightly off ground, make small rapid alternating kicks. Keep lower back pressed into floor. Good for hip flexor endurance. Often used in military fitness training. (AR)
description_en: A strengthening exercises exercise targeting the hip flexors.
description_ar: تمرين STRENGTHENING EXERCISES يستهدف Hip Flexors.

name_en: Stand in split stance (one foot forward), tuck tailbone under (posterior pelvic tilt), lean into front leg. Less intense than kneeling version but can be done anywhere. Good for brief stretching during work breaks.
name_ar: Stand in split stance (one foot forward), tuck tailbone under (posterior pelvic tilt), lean into front leg. Less intense than kneeling version but can be done anywhere. Good for brief stretching during work breaks. (AR)
description_en: A stretching exercises (essential for most people) exercise targeting the hip flexors.
description_ar: تمرين STRETCHING EXERCISES (Essential for Most People) يستهدف Hip Flexors.

name_en: Lie on back at edge of mat, pull one knee to chest, let other leg remain on floor. If extending leg rises off floor, hip flexors are tight. Gentle stretch similar to Thomas test position on floor.
name_ar: Lie on back at edge of mat, pull one knee to chest, let other leg remain on floor. If extending leg rises off floor, hip flexors are tight. Gentle stretch similar to Thomas test position on floor. (AR)
description_en: A stretching exercises (essential for most people) exercise targeting the hip flexors.
description_ar: تمرين STRETCHING EXERCISES (Essential for Most People) يستهدف Hip Flexors.
tips_en: Lie on back at edge of mat, pull one knee to chest, let other leg remain on floor. If extending leg rises off floor, hip flexors are tight. Gentle stretch similar to Thomas test position on floor.

name_en: Use rope around foot to assist stretching, hold stretch for only 2 seconds, return to start, repeat 10-15 times. Active stretching method that may produce better results than static stretching for some individuals.
name_ar: Use rope around foot to assist stretching, hold stretch for only 2 seconds, return to start, repeat 10-15 times. Active stretching method that may produce better results than static stretching for some individuals. (AR)
description_en: A stretching exercises (essential for most people) exercise targeting the hip flexors.
description_ar: تمرين STRETCHING EXERCISES (Essential for Most People) يستهدف Hip Flexors.
tips_en: Use rope around foot to assist stretching, hold stretch for only 2 seconds, return to start, repeat 10-15 times. Active stretching method that may produce better results than static stretching for some individuals.

name_en: Emphasize stretching, add glute strengthening, minimal hip flexor work
name_ar: Emphasize stretching, add glute strengthening, minimal hip flexor work (AR)
description_en: A dynamic/functional exercises exercise targeting the hip flexors.
description_ar: تمرين DYNAMIC/FUNCTIONAL EXERCISES يستهدف Hip Flexors.

name_en: *Decline reverse crunch* (on decline bench - harder); *weighted reverse crunch* (hold dumbbell between feet); *hanging reverse crunch* (on bar - advanced). Lie on back, knees bent, hands by sides or gripping something behind head. Curl knees toward chest while lifting hips off the floor (posterior pelvic tilt). The hip lift is the key—if you only move your legs, you're working hip flexors, not abs. Squeeze at top when hips are lifted.
name_ar: *Decline reverse crunch* (on decline bench - harder); *weighted reverse crunch* (hold dumbbell between feet); *hanging reverse crunch* (on bar - advanced). Lie on back, knees bent, hands by sides or gripping something behind head. Curl knees toward chest while lifting hips off the floor (posterior pelvic tilt). The hip lift is the key—if you only move your legs, you're working hip flexors, not abs. Squeeze at top when hips are lifted. (AR)
description_en: A rectus abdominis anatomy & overview exercise targeting the abs (rectus abdominis).
description_ar: تمرين RECTUS ABDOMINIS ANATOMY & OVERVIEW يستهدف Abs (Rectus Abdominis).

name_en: *Weighted stability ball crunch*; *decline stability ball crunch* (ball against wall, angle body downward). Lie back on stability ball, lower back supported, feet flat on floor. Crunch up by curling ribcage toward hips. Research shows 24-38% more rectus abdominis activation than floor crunches due to increased range of motion and instability. Excellent for complete ab development.
name_ar: *Weighted stability ball crunch*; *decline stability ball crunch* (ball against wall, angle body downward). Lie back on stability ball, lower back supported, feet flat on floor. Crunch up by curling ribcage toward hips. Research shows 24-38% more rectus abdominis activation than floor crunches due to increased range of motion and instability. Excellent for complete ab development. (AR)
description_en: A rectus abdominis anatomy & overview exercise targeting the abs (rectus abdominis).
description_ar: تمرين RECTUS ABDOMINIS ANATOMY & OVERVIEW يستهدف Abs (Rectus Abdominis).

name_en: *Kneeling cable crunch* (standard); *standing cable crunch*; *rope oblique crunch* (crunch to each side); *single-arm cable crunch*. Kneel facing cable, rope behind neck, crunch downward by flexing spine—round the back and bring elbows toward thighs. The key is curling the spine, not just hinging at the hips. Keep hips stationary. Allows progressive overload with measurable weight. Don't use too heavy—form degrades quickly.
name_ar: *Kneeling cable crunch* (standard); *standing cable crunch*; *rope oblique crunch* (crunch to each side); *single-arm cable crunch*. Kneel facing cable, rope behind neck, crunch downward by flexing spine—round the back and bring elbows toward thighs. The key is curling the spine, not just hinging at the hips. Keep hips stationary. Allows progressive overload with measurable weight. Don't use too heavy—form degrades quickly. (AR)
description_en: A rectus abdominis anatomy & overview exercise targeting the abs (rectus abdominis).
description_ar: تمرين RECTUS ABDOMINIS ANATOMY & OVERVIEW يستهدف Abs (Rectus Abdominis).

name_en: *Hanging oblique knee raise* (raise to each side); *weighted hanging knee raise* (dumbbell between feet); *tuck knee raise* (slower, more control). Hang from bar, raise knees toward chest while curling the pelvis up (posterior pelvic tilt). If just raising legs without pelvic curl, you're working hip flexors, not abs. Second highest ab activation in ACE study. Progress to straight leg version.
name_ar: *Hanging oblique knee raise* (raise to each side); *weighted hanging knee raise* (dumbbell between feet); *tuck knee raise* (slower, more control). Hang from bar, raise knees toward chest while curling the pelvis up (posterior pelvic tilt). If just raising legs without pelvic curl, you're working hip flexors, not abs. Second highest ab activation in ACE study. Progress to straight leg version. (AR)
description_en: A rectus abdominis anatomy & overview exercise targeting the abs (rectus abdominis).
description_ar: تمرين RECTUS ABDOMINIS ANATOMY & OVERVIEW يستهدف Abs (Rectus Abdominis).

name_en: *Captain's chair oblique raise* (raise to each side); *straight leg raise*. Support body on forearms in captain's chair, raise knees toward chest with pelvic curl. The back support makes it easier than hanging version—good progression step. Ranked #2 in ACE study for rectus abdominis activation. Same form cues as hanging raises—curl the pelvis.
name_ar: *Captain's chair oblique raise* (raise to each side); *straight leg raise*. Support body on forearms in captain's chair, raise knees toward chest with pelvic curl. The back support makes it easier than hanging version—good progression step. Ranked #2 in ACE study for rectus abdominis activation. Same form cues as hanging raises—curl the pelvis. (AR)
description_en: A rectus abdominis anatomy & overview exercise targeting the abs (rectus abdominis).
description_ar: تمرين RECTUS ABDOMINIS ANATOMY & OVERVIEW يستهدف Abs (Rectus Abdominis).

name_en: *Weighted dead bug* (hold dumbbell); *banded dead bug* (band around feet); *dead bug with reach*. Lie on back, arms toward ceiling, knees bent 90°. Lower opposite arm and leg toward floor while keeping lower back pressed flat. The challenge is maintaining spinal position while limbs move. Excellent for learning proper bracing and anti-extension. Great for those with lower back issues.
name_ar: *Weighted dead bug* (hold dumbbell); *banded dead bug* (band around feet); *dead bug with reach*. Lie on back, arms toward ceiling, knees bent 90°. Lower opposite arm and leg toward floor while keeping lower back pressed flat. The challenge is maintaining spinal position while limbs move. Excellent for learning proper bracing and anti-extension. Great for those with lower back issues. (AR)
description_en: A rectus abdominis anatomy & overview exercise targeting the abs (rectus abdominis).
description_ar: تمرين RECTUS ABDOMINIS ANATOMY & OVERVIEW يستهدف Abs (Rectus Abdominis).

name_en: *Weighted decline sit-up* (hold plate on chest); *decline crunch* (partial ROM - less hip flexor). Feet anchored at top of decline bench, sit up then lower with control. The decline increases difficulty. Don't go all the way up into full sit-up—this is hip flexor work. Focus on curling the spine, not hinging at hips.
name_ar: *Weighted decline sit-up* (hold plate on chest); *decline crunch* (partial ROM - less hip flexor). Feet anchored at top of decline bench, sit up then lower with control. The decline increases difficulty. Don't go all the way up into full sit-up—this is hip flexor work. Focus on curling the spine, not hinging at hips. (AR)
description_en: A rectus abdominis anatomy & overview exercise targeting the abs (rectus abdominis).
description_ar: تمرين RECTUS ABDOMINIS ANATOMY & OVERVIEW يستهدف Abs (Rectus Abdominis).

name_en: *Single-leg lying raise*; *weighted lying raise* (ankle weights). Lie on back, hands under hips or by sides, raise straight legs to 90° then lower. Keep lower back pressed into floor at all times. If back arches, don't lower legs as far or bend knees slightly. Often done wrong—many people let back arch, shifting stress to spine.
name_ar: *Single-leg lying raise*; *weighted lying raise* (ankle weights). Lie on back, hands under hips or by sides, raise straight legs to 90° then lower. Keep lower back pressed into floor at all times. If back arches, don't lower legs as far or bend knees slightly. Often done wrong—many people let back arch, shifting stress to spine. (AR)
description_en: A rectus abdominis anatomy & overview exercise targeting the abs (rectus abdominis).
description_ar: تمرين RECTUS ABDOMINIS ANATOMY & OVERVIEW يستهدف Abs (Rectus Abdominis).

name_en: Lie on back, legs vertical (perpendicular to floor), crunch up reaching hands toward toes. The vertical leg position changes the lever. Focus on curling upper back off floor, not just reaching with arms.
name_ar: Lie on back, legs vertical (perpendicular to floor), crunch up reaching hands toward toes. The vertical leg position changes the lever. Focus on curling upper back off floor, not just reaching with arms. (AR)
description_en: A rectus abdominis anatomy & overview exercise targeting the abs (rectus abdominis).
description_ar: تمرين RECTUS ABDOMINIS ANATOMY & OVERVIEW يستهدف Abs (Rectus Abdominis).

name_en: Forearm plank with feet on sliders, slide body forward and backward while maintaining plank position. The sliding motion increases anti-extension demand. Keep core tight throughout—don't let hips sag.
name_ar: Forearm plank with feet on sliders, slide body forward and backward while maintaining plank position. The sliding motion increases anti-extension demand. Keep core tight throughout—don't let hips sag. (AR)
description_en: A rectus abdominis anatomy & overview exercise targeting the abs (rectus abdominis).
description_ar: تمرين RECTUS ABDOMINIS ANATOMY & OVERVIEW يستهدف Abs (Rectus Abdominis).

name_en: Reverse crunches, hanging leg raises (with pelvic curl), dead bugs
name_ar: Reverse crunches, hanging leg raises (with pelvic curl), dead bugs (AR)
description_en: A rectus abdominis anatomy & overview exercise targeting the abs (rectus abdominis).
description_ar: تمرين RECTUS ABDOMINIS ANATOMY & OVERVIEW يستهدف Abs (Rectus Abdominis).

name_en: Crunches, cable crunches, stability ball crunches
name_ar: Crunches, cable crunches, stability ball crunches (AR)
description_en: A rectus abdominis anatomy & overview exercise targeting the abs (rectus abdominis).
description_ar: تمرين RECTUS ABDOMINIS ANATOMY & OVERVIEW يستهدف Abs (Rectus Abdominis).

name_en: *High-to-low wood chop* (chop downward - more oblique emphasis); *low-to-high wood chop* (chop upward - also hits shoulders); *half kneeling wood chop* (eliminates hip rotation, isolates core); *medicine ball wood chop*; *band wood chop*. Stand perpendicular to cable, rotate and pull diagonally across body. Excellent for rotational power used in throwing, swinging sports. The diagonal pattern mimics real-world rotation. Keep hips relatively stable—rotation should come from trunk.
name_ar: *High-to-low wood chop* (chop downward - more oblique emphasis); *low-to-high wood chop* (chop upward - also hits shoulders); *half kneeling wood chop* (eliminates hip rotation, isolates core); *medicine ball wood chop*; *band wood chop*. Stand perpendicular to cable, rotate and pull diagonally across body. Excellent for rotational power used in throwing, swinging sports. The diagonal pattern mimics real-world rotation. Keep hips relatively stable—rotation should come from trunk. (AR)
description_en: A oblique anatomy & overview exercise targeting the obliques.
description_ar: تمرين OBLIQUE ANATOMY & OVERVIEW يستهدف Obliques.

name_en: *Standing oblique crunch*; *decline oblique crunch*; *cable oblique crunch*. Lie on side or back (for standing: stand tall), bend sideways bringing ribs toward hip on same side. Isolates lateral flexion. Range of motion is naturally small. Focus on squeeze/contraction at top.
name_ar: *Standing oblique crunch*; *decline oblique crunch*; *cable oblique crunch*. Lie on side or back (for standing: stand tall), bend sideways bringing ribs toward hip on same side. Isolates lateral flexion. Range of motion is naturally small. Focus on squeeze/contraction at top. (AR)
description_en: A oblique anatomy & overview exercise targeting the obliques.
description_ar: تمرين OBLIQUE ANATOMY & OVERVIEW يستهدف Obliques.

name_en: Plank position, drive knee toward opposite elbow, alternate rapidly. Adds rotational component to standard mountain climber. The cross-body pattern engages obliques. Can be done fast (cardio) or slow (strength).
name_ar: Plank position, drive knee toward opposite elbow, alternate rapidly. Adds rotational component to standard mountain climber. The cross-body pattern engages obliques. Can be done fast (cardio) or slow (strength). (AR)
description_en: A oblique anatomy & overview exercise targeting the obliques.
description_ar: تمرين OBLIQUE ANATOMY & OVERVIEW يستهدف Obliques.

name_en: *Landmine 180s* (rotate bar from side to side in arc); *half kneeling landmine rotation* (more isolated). Hold end of barbell anchored at one end, rotate bar side to side in arc around body. Excellent for rotational power and strength. The arc path naturally guides proper rotation mechanics. Keep hips facing forward—rotation from trunk only.
name_ar: *Landmine 180s* (rotate bar from side to side in arc); *half kneeling landmine rotation* (more isolated). Hold end of barbell anchored at one end, rotate bar side to side in arc around body. Excellent for rotational power and strength. The arc path naturally guides proper rotation mechanics. Keep hips facing forward—rotation from trunk only. (AR)
description_en: A oblique anatomy & overview exercise targeting the obliques.
description_ar: تمرين OBLIQUE ANATOMY & OVERVIEW يستهدف Obliques.

name_en: Side plank position with top leg resting on bench (not bottom leg). Creates extreme demand on obliques and adductors. Significantly harder than regular side plank. Popular in sports rehab for adductor strength. Start with short holds.
name_ar: Side plank position with top leg resting on bench (not bottom leg). Creates extreme demand on obliques and adductors. Significantly harder than regular side plank. Popular in sports rehab for adductor strength. Start with short holds. (AR)
description_en: A oblique anatomy & overview exercise targeting the obliques.
description_ar: تمرين OBLIQUE ANATOMY & OVERVIEW يستهدف Obliques.

name_en: During plank or push-up, bring knee to same-side elbow. Adds hip flexion and oblique engagement to plank position. Good for adding variety.
name_ar: During plank or push-up, bring knee to same-side elbow. Adds hip flexion and oblique engagement to plank position. Good for adding variety. (AR)
description_en: A oblique anatomy & overview exercise targeting the obliques.
description_ar: تمرين OBLIQUE ANATOMY & OVERVIEW يستهدف Obliques.

name_en: Stand with cable at chest height, rotate away from machine. Similar to wood chop but horizontal rotation. Keep hips stable, rotate through trunk only. Good for isolated rotation work.
name_ar: Stand with cable at chest height, rotate away from machine. Similar to wood chop but horizontal rotation. Keep hips stable, rotate through trunk only. Good for isolated rotation work. (AR)
description_en: A oblique anatomy & overview exercise targeting the obliques.
description_ar: تمرين OBLIQUE ANATOMY & OVERVIEW يستهدف Obliques.

name_en: Hold body horizontal while gripping vertical pole. One of the most impressive feats of core strength. Requires months/years of progressive training. Ultimate oblique strength demonstration.
name_ar: Hold body horizontal while gripping vertical pole. One of the most impressive feats of core strength. Requires months/years of progressive training. Ultimate oblique strength demonstration. (AR)
description_en: A oblique anatomy & overview exercise targeting the obliques.
description_ar: تمرين OBLIQUE ANATOMY & OVERVIEW يستهدف Obliques.

name_en: Stand perpendicular to wall, rotate and throw ball explosively, catch and repeat. Develops rotational power for sports. Only do after building anti-rotation stability. Keep feet planted, rotate through hips and trunk.
name_ar: Stand perpendicular to wall, rotate and throw ball explosively, catch and repeat. Develops rotational power for sports. Only do after building anti-rotation stability. Keep feet planted, rotate through hips and trunk. (AR)
description_en: A oblique anatomy & overview exercise targeting the obliques.
description_ar: تمرين OBLIQUE ANATOMY & OVERVIEW يستهدف Obliques.

name_en: *Tuck hollow hold* (knees bent - easier); *straddle hollow* (legs wide); *hollow body rock*. Lie on back, press lower back into floor, raise shoulders and legs, hold "banana" position. Gymnastics foundation position. Zero gap between lower back and floor. Arms by ears is hardest progression. Teaches total core engagement. Hold 20-60 seconds.
name_ar: *Tuck hollow hold* (knees bent - easier); *straddle hollow* (legs wide); *hollow body rock*. Lie on back, press lower back into floor, raise shoulders and legs, hold "banana" position. Gymnastics foundation position. Zero gap between lower back and floor. Arms by ears is hardest progression. Teaches total core engagement. Hold 20-60 seconds. (AR)
description_en: A transverse abdominis anatomy & overview exercise targeting the transverse abdominis (deep core).
description_ar: تمرين TRANSVERSE ABDOMINIS ANATOMY & OVERVIEW يستهدف Transverse Abdominis (Deep Core).

name_en: Plank position, lift one hand to tap opposite shoulder, alternate while keeping hips completely still. The goal is zero hip rotation despite weight shift. Combines anti-extension with anti-rotation. Harder than it looks when done correctly. Wider foot stance = easier.
name_ar: Plank position, lift one hand to tap opposite shoulder, alternate while keeping hips completely still. The goal is zero hip rotation despite weight shift. Combines anti-extension with anti-rotation. Harder than it looks when done correctly. Wider foot stance = easier. (AR)
description_en: A transverse abdominis anatomy & overview exercise targeting the transverse abdominis (deep core).
description_ar: تمرين TRANSVERSE ABDOMINIS ANATOMY & OVERVIEW يستهدف Transverse Abdominis (Deep Core).

name_en: Forearm plank with forearms on stability ball, make small circles with forearms ("stirring"). The unstable surface and circular motion dramatically increase TVA demand. One of the most challenging plank progressions. Shown in research to have extremely high core activation. Start with small circles.
name_ar: Forearm plank with forearms on stability ball, make small circles with forearms ("stirring"). The unstable surface and circular motion dramatically increase TVA demand.
